sentence.text: MULTAQ (dronedarone) tablet, film coated
Dronedarone HCl is a white fine powder that is practically insoluble in water and freely soluble in methylene chloride and methanol.
MULTAQ is contraindicated in patients with:
Concomitant use of strong CYP 3A inhibitors, such as ketoconazole, itraconazole, voriconazole, cyclosporine, telithromycin, clarithromycin, nefazodone, and ritonavir [see Drug Interactions (7.2)]

Concomitant use of drugs or herbal products that prolong the QT interval and might increase the risk of Torsade de Pointes, such as phenothiazine anti-psychotics, tricyclic antidepressants, certain oral macrolide antibiotics, and Class I and III antiarrhythmics

entity.text: drugs or herbal products that prolong the QT interval

mmtx.phraseText: the risk of Torsade de Pointes,

ellipsisSentence.text: MULTAQ is contraindicated in patients with:

middleSentence.text: Permanent atrial fibrillation (patients in whom normal sinus rhythm will not or cannot be restored) [see Boxed Warning and Warnings and Precautions (5.2)]
Symptomatic heart failure with recent decompensation requiring hospitalization or NYHA Class IV symptoms [see Boxed Warning and Warnings and Precautions (5.1)]
Second- or third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block, or sick sinus syndrome (except when used in conjunction with a functioning pacemaker)
Bradycardia <50 bpm
Concomitant use of strong CYP 3A inhibitors, such as ketoconazole, itraconazole, voriconazole, cyclosporine, telithromycin, clarithromycin, nefazodone, and ritonavir [see Drug Interactions (7.2)]

sentence.text: Hypokalemia or hypomagnesemia may occur with concomitant administration of potassium-depleting diuretics.

mmtx.phraseText: occur with concomitant administration of potassium-depleting diuretics.

ellipsisSentence.text: If pulmonary toxicity is confirmed, MULTAQ should be discontinued.

middleSentence.text: 5.7 Hypokalemia and Hypomagnesemia with Potassium-Depleting Diuretics

ellipsisSentence.text: If pulmonary toxicity is confirmed, MULTAQ should be discontinued.

middleSentence.text: 5.7 Hypokalemia and Hypomagnesemia with Potassium-Depleting Diuretics

sentence.text: Potassium levels should be within the normal range prior to administration of MULTAQ and maintained in the normal range during administration of MULTAQ.

Co-administration of drugs prolonging the QT interval (such as certain phenothiazines, tricyclic antidepressants, certain macrolide antibiotics, and Class I and III antiarrhythmics) is contraindicated because of the potential risk of Torsade de Pointes-type ventricular tachycardia [see Contraindications (4), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

mmtx.phraseText: contraindicated because of the potential risk of Torsade de Pointes-type ventricular tachycardia

ellipsisSentence.text: Premenopausal women who have not undergone a hysterectomy or oophorectomy must use effective contraception while using MULTAQ.

middleSentence.text: Dronedarone caused fetal harm in animal studies at doses equivalent to recommended human doses.
Counsel women of childbearing potential regarding appropriate contraceptive choices [see Use in Specific Populations (8.1)].
7 DRUG INTERACTIONS
7.1 Pharmacodynamic Interactions
Drugs prolonging the QT interval (inducing Torsade de Pointes)

ellipsisSentence.text: Premenopausal women who have not undergone a hysterectomy or oophorectomy must use effective contraception while using MULTAQ.

middleSentence.text: Dronedarone caused fetal harm in animal studies at doses equivalent to recommended human doses.
Counsel women of childbearing potential regarding appropriate contraceptive choices [see Use in Specific Populations (8.1)].
7 DRUG INTERACTIONS
7.1 Pharmacodynamic Interactions
Drugs prolonging the QT interval (inducing Torsade de Pointes)

sentence.text: In the ANDROMEDA (patients with recently decompensated heart failure) and PALLAS (patients with permanent AF) trials baseline use of digoxin was associated with an increased risk of arrhythmic or sudden death in dronedarone-treated patients compared to placebo.

entity.text: ANDROMEDA (patients with recently decompensated heart failure) trials

mmtx.phraseText: (patients with permanent AF) trials baseline use of digoxin

sentence.text: In patients not taking digoxin, no difference in risk of sudden death was observed in the dronedarone vs. placebo groups.
Digoxin can potentiate the electrophysiologic effects of dronedarone (such as decreased AV-node conduction).
Dronedarone increases exposure to digoxin [see Drug Interactions (7.3), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].
Consider discontinuing digoxin.

ellipsisSentence.text: Dronedarone increases exposure to digoxin [see Drug Interactions (7.3), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

sentence.text: If digoxin treatment is continued, halve the dose of digoxin, monitor serum levels closely, and observe for toxicity.

ellipsisSentence.text: Dronedarone increases exposure to digoxin [see Drug Interactions (7.3), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

middleSentence.text: Consider discontinuing digoxin.

ellipsisSentence.text: Dronedarone increases exposure to digoxin [see Drug Interactions (7.3), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

middleSentence.text: Consider discontinuing digoxin.

sentence.text: Calcium channel blockers with depressant effects on the sinus and AV nodes could potentiate dronedarone's effects on conduction.

entity.text: Calcium channel blockers with depressant effects on the sinus and AV nodes

mmtx.phraseText: Calcium channel blockers with depressant effects

sentence.text: Give a low dose of calcium channel blockers initially and increase only after ECG verification of good tolerability [see Drug Interactions (7.3), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

mmtx.phraseText: a low dose of calcium channel blockers initially

ellipsisSentence.text: Calcium channel blockers with depressant effects on the sinus and AV nodes could potentiate dronedarone's effects on conduction.

sentence.text: In clinical trials, bradycardia was more frequently observed when dronedarone was given in combination with beta-blockers.
Give a low dose of beta-blockers initially, and increase only after ECG verification of good tolerability [see Drug Interactions (7.3), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

mmtx.phraseText: a low dose of beta-blockers initially,

ellipsisSentence.text: In clinical trials, bradycardia was more frequently observed when dronedarone was given in combination with beta-blockers.

sentence.text: Concomitant use of ketoconazole as well as other potent CYP 3A inhibitors such as itraconazole, voriconazole, ritonavir, clarithromycin, and nefazodone is contraindicated because exposure to dronedarone is significantly increased [see Contraindications (4), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

mmtx.phraseText: other potent CYP 3A inhibitors such as itraconazole,

sentence.text: Patients should avoid grapefruit juice beverages while taking MULTAQ because exposure to dronedarone is significantly increased [see Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

Avoid rifampin or other CYP 3A inducers such as phenobarbital, carbamazepine, phenytoin, and St John's wort because they decrease exposure to dronedarone significantly [see Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

mmtx.phraseText: other CYP 3A inducers such as phenobarbital,

sentence.text: Verapamil and diltiazem are moderate CYP 3A inhibitors and increase dronedarone exposure.
Give a low dose of calcium channel blockers initially and increase only after ECG verification of good tolerability [see Drug Interactions (7.3), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

mmtx.phraseText: a low dose of calcium channel blockers initially

ellipsisSentence.text: Verapamil and diltiazem are moderate CYP 3A inhibitors and increase dronedarone exposure.

sentence.text: Dronedarone increased simvastatin/simvastatin acid exposure.
Avoid doses greater than 10 mg once daily of simvastatin [see Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

ellipsisSentence.text: Dronedarone increased simvastatin/simvastatin acid exposure.

sentence.text: Because of multiple mechanisms of interaction with statins (CYPs and transporters), follow statin label recommendations for use with CYP 3A and P-gp inhibitors such as dronedarone.
Dronedarone increased the exposure of calcium channel blockers (verapamil, diltiazem or nifedipine).

mmtx.phraseText: the exposure of calcium channel blockers

sentence.text: Give a low dose of calcium channel blockers initially and increase only after ECG verification of good tolerability [see Drug Interactions (7.1), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].

mmtx.phraseText: a low dose of calcium channel blockers initially

ellipsisSentence.text: Dronedarone increased the exposure of calcium channel blockers (verapamil, diltiazem or nifedipine).

sentence.text: Sirolimus, tacrolimus, and other CYP3A substrates with narrow therapeutic range
Dronedarone can increase plasma concentrations of tacrolimus, sirolimus, and other CYP 3A substrates with a narrow therapeutic range when given orally.

entity.text: CYP 3A substrates with a narrow therapeutic range

sentence.text: Monitor plasma concentrations and adjust dosage appropriately.

ellipsisSentence.text: Dronedarone can increase plasma concentrations of tacrolimus, sirolimus, and other CYP 3A substrates with a narrow therapeutic range when given orally.

sentence.text: Dronedarone increased the exposure of propranolol and metoprolol.
Give low doses of beta-blockers initially, and increase only after ECG verification of good tolerability.

ellipsisSentence.text: Dronedarone increased the exposure of propranolol and metoprolol.

sentence.text: Other CYP 2D6 substrates, including other beta-blockers, tricyclic antidepressants, and selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) may have increased exposure upon co-administration with dronedarone [see Drug Interactions (7.1), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].
Dronedarone increased digoxin exposure by inhibiting the P-gp transporter.

sentence.text: Exposure to dabigatran is higher when it is administered with dronedarone than when it is administered alone.
Other P-gp substrates are expected to have increased exposure when co-administered with dronedarone.
When co-administered with dronedarone exposure to S-warfarin was slightly higher than when warfarin was administered alone.

co-administered with dronedarone exposure to S-warfarin

sentence.text: More patients experienced clinically significant INR elevations ( 5) usually within 1 week after starting dronedarone vs. placebo in patients taking oral anticoagulants in ATHENA.
Postmarketing cases of increased INR with or without bleeding events have been reported in warfarin-treated patients initiated on dronedarone.
Monitor INR after initiating dronedarone in patients taking warfarin.
